verses.text: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz , which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah , Jotham , Ahaz , \add and\add* Hezekiah , kings of Judah. \p
Hear , O heavens , and give ear , O earth : for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath spoken , I have nourished and brought up children , and they have rebelled against me.
The ox knoweth his owner , and the ass his master’s crib : \add but\add* Israel doth not know , my people doth not consider.

Ah sinful nation , a people laden with iniquity , a seed of evildoers , children that are corrupters : they have forsaken the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, they have provoked the Holy One of Israel unto anger , they are gone away backward.\f + \fr 1.4 \ft laden: Heb. of heaviness\f*\f + \fr 1.4 \ft gone…: Heb. alienated, or, separated\f* \p
¶ Why should ye be stricken any more? ye will revolt more and more : the whole head is sick , and the whole heart faint.\f + \fr 1.5 \ft revolt…: Heb. increase revolt\f*

From the sole of the foot even unto the head \add there is\add* no soundness in it; \add but\add* wounds , and bruises , and putrifying sores : they have not been closed , neither bound up , neither mollified with ointment.\f + \fr 1.6 \ft ointment: or, oil\f*

Your country \add is\add* desolate , your cities \add are\add* burned with fire : your land , strangers devour it in your presence, and \add it is\add* desolate , as overthrown by strangers.\f + \fr 1.7 \ft overthrown…: Heb. the overthrow of\f*
And the daughter of Zion is left as a cottage in a vineyard , as a lodge in a garden of cucumbers , as a besieged city.
Except the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts had left unto us a very small remnant , we should have been as Sodom , \add and\add* we should have been like unto Gomorrah. \p
¶ Hear the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, ye rulers of Sodom ; give ear unto the law of our God , ye people of Gomorrah.

To what purpose \add is\add* the multitude of your sacrifices unto me? saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: I am full of the burnt offerings of rams , and the fat of fed beasts ; and I delight not in the blood of bullocks , or of lambs , or of he goats.\f + \fr 1.11 \ft he goats: Heb. great he goats\f*
When ye come to appear before me, who hath required this at your hand , to tread my courts ?\f + \fr 1.12 \ft to appear: Heb. to be seen\f*

Bring no more vain oblations ; incense is an abomination unto me; the new moons and sabbaths , the calling of assemblies , I cannot away with ; \add it is\add* iniquity , even the solemn meeting.\f + \fr 1.13 \ft iniquity: or, grief\f*
Your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hateth : they are a trouble unto me; I am weary to bear \add them\add*.

And when ye spread forth your hands , I will hide mine eyes from you: yea, when ye make many prayers , I will not hear : your hands are full of blood.\f + \fr 1.15 \ft make…: Heb. multiply prayer\f*\f + \fr 1.15 \ft blood: Heb. bloods\f* \p
¶ Wash you, make you clean ; put away the evil of your doings from before mine eyes ; cease to do evil ;
Learn to do well ; seek judgment , relieve the oppressed , judge the fatherless , plead for the widow.\f + \fr 1.17 \ft relieve: or, righten\f*

Come now , and let us reason together , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: though your sins be as scarlet , they shall be as white as snow ; though they be red like crimson , they shall be as wool.
If ye be willing and obedient , ye shall eat the good of the land :
But if ye refuse and rebel , ye shall be devoured with the sword : for the mouth of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath spoken \add it\add*. \p
¶ How is the faithful city become an harlot ! it was full of judgment ; righteousness lodged in it; but now murderers.
Thy silver is become dross , thy wine mixed with water :

Thy princes \add are\add* rebellious , and companions of thieves : every one loveth gifts , and followeth after rewards : they judge not the fatherless , neither doth the cause of the widow come unto them.
Therefore saith the Lord , the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , the mighty One of Israel , Ah , I will ease me of mine adversaries , and avenge me of mine enemies : \p
¶ And I will turn my hand upon thee, and purely purge away thy dross , and take away all thy tin :\f + \fr 1.25 \ft purely: Heb. according to pureness\f*
And I will restore thy judges as at the first , and thy counsellors as at the beginning : afterward thou shalt be called , The city of righteousness , the faithful city.
Zion shall be redeemed with judgment , and her converts with righteousness.\f + \fr 1.27 \ft her…: or, they that return of her\f* \p

¶ And the destruction of the transgressors and of the sinners \add shall be\add* together , and they that forsake the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall be consumed.\f + \fr 1.28 \ft destruction: Heb. breaking\f*
For they shall be ashamed of the oaks which ye have desired , and ye shall be confounded for the gardens that ye have chosen.
For ye shall be as an oak whose leaf fadeth , and as a garden that hath no water.
And the strong shall be as tow , and the maker of it as a spark , and they shall both burn together , and none shall quench \add them\add*.\f + \fr 1.31 \ft maker…: or, and his work\f*
